content.body: What does `MV` stand for in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-string-literals-static-semantics-mv? _M-escape Value_?
content.formatted_body: What does MV stand for in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-string-literals-static-semantics-mv? M-escape Value?

content.body: * What does `MV` stand for in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-string-literals-static-semantics-mv? _Mescape Value_?
content.formatted_body: * What does MV stand for in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-string-literals-static-semantics-mv? Mescape Value?

m.new_content.body: What does `MV` stand for in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-string-literals-static-semantics-mv? _Mescape Value_?
m.new_content.formatted_body: What does MV stand for in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-string-literals-static-semantics-mv? Mescape Value?

content.body: I think mathematical value? It's computing the escape code point number
The spec used to have phrasing like "are interpreted as having a mathematical value (MV), as described below" until PR #2451 was merged.
maybe it'd be helpful to expand this acronym in an editorial PR?
Do you mean add a sentence that gives the expansion, or change the SDO name to something longer?
change the SDO name to something longer
(more sentences of explanation are good too but I was suggesting the latter)
